page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Little Kingshill is a small village in the Chilterns. It has a school,a chapel,two pubs,a scout hut and a cricket club. Various groups meet regularly in the Village Hall,such as the W.I.,Brownies,Guides and the Gardening Club. There are no shops in the village but a small garden centre opens in the summer months. The area is rural despite being within easy access of London. Many people commute to the Capital or work in the neighbouring towns of Amersham, Chesham,High Wycombe or Aylesbury. The Chiltern Hills are very popular with walkers and ramblers.Many people come here to use the numerous public footpaths and enjoy the countryside. The nearest station is Gt. Missenden with a regular service to London,but buses are less frequent and most people are dependent on private cars.
